snippet: Counter to their expectations, researchers discovered that locusts thrive on land that is lower in nitrogen nutrients.
abstract: Counter to their expectations, researchers discovered that locusts thrive on land that is lower in nitrogen nutrients.
lead_paragraph: Locusts, one of the 10 plagues of biblical lore, remain a real threat to survival for farmers around the world. From 2003 to 2005, for example, swarms of the desert locust decimated crops throughout West Africa, causing at least $2.5 billion in lost harvests. It cost $400 million to bring under control, according to the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.

headline.main: For Locusts, Overgrazed Land Is a Treat
